thread.title: Season picks: Can Red Wings advance past 1st round?

title: Season picks: Can Red Wings advance past 1st round?
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Season picks: Can Red Wings advance past 1st round? Will the Wings make the playoffs for a 25th straight season; will they advance past the first round of the playoffs? Post to Facebook Season picks: Can Red Wings advance past 1st round? Will the Wings make the playoffs for a 25th straight season; will they advance past the first round of the playoffs? Check out this story on Freep.com: http://on.freep.com/1Lj1z4y Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Season picks: Can Red Wings advance past 1st round? Detroit Free Press Staff 10:22 p.m. EDT October 7, 2015 Detroit Red Wings goalie Jimmy Howard. (Photo: Paul Sancya, Associated Press) 1 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Will the Wings make the playoffs for a 25th straight season and will they advance past the first round of the playoffs? 
Mitch Albom: Yes 
It’s still a first class organization and organizations can find ways to build and win. Jeff Blashill will be motivated to the highest level and the locker room might react well to a fresh approach. Will they make it past the first round? Hey, Stanley Cup finalists have been bounced in the first round. But if they get there, I think the excitement will carry them to Round 2. 
Stanley Cup finals: Lightning over Ducks in six. 
Jeff Seidel: Yes 
Jeff Blashill has won wherever he has coached, and this is a winning franchise with a winning culture. The veterans are already feeling rejuvenated under Blashill, but he will ride his young guns into the playoffs, the same players that gave this organization a Calder Cup. Blashill has a strong track record in one-and-done games, and that will propel the Wings past the first round. 
Stanley Cup finals: Blackhawks over Lightning in six (again). 
Drew Sharp: No 
The bigger streak lives on. But unfortunately for the organization, the smaller streak lives on as well. The Wings’ failure in getting past the second round is now six years old. It will be seven next spring. Worse, it will be three straight playoffs in which they failed to get out of the first round — and four times in five years. But at least they’re getting younger, right? 
Stanley Cup finals: Blackhawks over Rangers in six. 
George Sipple: Yes 
The playoff streak didn’t begin with Mike Babcock. It’s not going to end just because he left town. New coach Jeff Blashill will guide the Wings into the second round, but the East has too many other good teams to expect a deeper run. 
Stanley Cup finals: Ducks over Capitals in six. 
Helene St. James: Yes 
This is a Wings team invigorated by two key veterans, a new coach, and motivated by two straight first-round exits. There is depth at every position, and a remarkable good opening night lineup considering Pavel Datsyuk is missing. The Wings have the elements to contend with anyone, so that one-and-done trend should end. 
Stanley Cup finals: Ducks over Penguins in six.
